tn.ref: He did what was evil in the sight of Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:14:01|14:2]]

tn.ref: like the disgusting things of the nations whom Yahweh had driven out before the people of Israel
tn.text: AT: "as did the other people groups whom Yahweh caused to be defeated by the people of Israel." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: my name will be placed
tn.text: AT: "I will make myself known to people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: he put his sons into the fire
tn.text: This refers to the practice of burning children alive as sacrifices to idols. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: Valley of Ben Hinnom
tn.text: A place near Jerusalem also known as Gehenna.

tn.ref: Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem
tn.text: AT: "the people of Judah and Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: brought on them
tn.text: AT: "brought about an attack on them by" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: took Manasseh in chains, bound him with fetters, and took him off to Babylon.
tn.text: AT: "siezed Manasseh and took him as a prisoner to Babylon." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: He prayed to him; and God was begged by him
tn.text: The second phrase intensifies the first phrase and emphasizes the earnestness of Manasseh's prayer. AT: "He prayed to God and begged God." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: into his kingship
tn.text: This means "to rule again over the nation."

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]

tn.ref: the foreign gods
tn.text: AT: "the false gods from other countries"

tn.ref: he commanded Judah
tn.text: AT: "he commanded the people of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: written among the deeds of the kings of Israel
tn.text: This in account of the history of Israel that no longer exists.

tn.ref: the Chronicles of the Seers
tn.text: This is a book that no longer exists.

tn.ref: So Manasseh slept with his ancestors, and they buried him
tn.text: AT: "So Manasseh died, and his family buried him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: Amon
tn.text: (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: He did what was evil in the sight of Yahweh
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2ch:14:01|14:2]]

tn.ref: this same Amon trespassed more and more
tn.text: AT: "Amon sinned more"

tn.ref: conspired
tn.text: AT: "planned in secret"
